lead_paragraph: Paraquat, one of many pesticides that can’t be used in Europe but is sold in the United States and elsewhere, has been linked to Parkinson’s disease in a growing body of research.

byline.contributor: Hari Kumar contributed reporting from New Delhi. Cao Li contributed research from Beijing.

headline.print_headline: A Weed Killer Made in Britain, for Export Only
headline.main: This Pesticide Is Prohibited in Britain. Why Is It Still Being Exported?

snippet: Paraquat, one of many pesticides that can’t be used in Europe but is sold in the United States and elsewhere, has been linked to Parkinson’s disease in a growing body of research....
abstract: City of Huddersfield, England, continues to manufacture weed killer paraquat, despite product being illegal in Great Britain and rest of European Union; paraquat, which is manufactured by Syngenta and has been linked to Parkinson's disease, is still used in United States; EPA is weighing whether to phase out chemical, though it is unclear how Trump administration will view matter (Series: Uncertain Harvest).
